ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.7_0: “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.8_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.9_0: “How can Venerable Channa say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.10_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.’” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.11_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you said this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.12_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.16_0: ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.19.1_0: ‘If a monk says to a monk who is legitimately corrected by him like this, but then I’ll question him on the Monastic Law.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.20_0: A monk who is training should understand, should question, should enquire.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.8_0: about whatever training rule has been laid down by the Buddha—this is called “legitimately”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.9_0: When corrected in regard to this, he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.9_1: If he is astute, competent, clever, and intelligent, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.1_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.2_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.3_0: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.4_0: If he is corrected about something that has not been laid down:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.5_0: “This isn’t conducive to the erasing of defilements,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s competent,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s wise,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s intelligent,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s learned,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.6_0: If he is corrected by one who is not fully ordained about something that has or has not been laid down:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.7_0: “This isn’t conducive to the erasing of defilements,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s competent,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s wise,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s intelligent,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s learned,” “... until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.8_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.9_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.10_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.12_0: if you want to train in the training,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.16_0: should ask, “Venerable, how is this? What’s the meaning of this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.2_0: if he says, “I’ll speak,” and he says,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.5_0: The first rule, the training rule on legitimately, is finished.
